actions.text: Referred to Senate Committee on Judiciary.

official_title: A concurrent resolution to establish National Space Week.

summary.text: Requests the President to issue a proclamation designating the first week of October 1973 as National Space Week and re-affirming the decision of recent years that the United States, having successfully completed the Apollo program, is in space to stay, and is proceeding with new programs to use space and space technology for the benefit of the American people and all mankind.

titles.title: A concurrent resolution to establish National Space Week.
